model.card_game package¶

Submodules¶

model.card_game.card module¶

class model.card_game.card.Card(value: Value, suit: Suit, face_up: bool = False)¶

Bases: object

Class to represent a playing card from a standard deck of cards.

value¶

The Value of the card Ace, Two, Three … King

suit¶

The Suit of the card Diamonds, Spades etc.

face_up¶

A boolean set to True if the card is face up.

description(ignore_face_up: bool) → str¶

Returns a text description of the Card.

Parameters:

  • ignore_face_up – A boolean set to True to return the full

  • False. (description of the Card even if face_up is) –

Returns:

A string describing the Card.

model.card_game.card_group module¶

class model.card_game.card_group.CardGroup(name: str)¶

Bases: object

Class to represent a group cards.

The is a generic structure that could be the main deck that cards are dealt from, a player’s hand or the discard pile.

name¶

A string describing this card group.

cards¶

A list of Card instances.

description() → str¶

Returns a text description of the CardGroup.

Returns:

A string describing the CardGroup.

shuffle()¶

Shuffles the Cards in this object into a random order.

model.card_game.deck module¶

class model.card_game.deck.Deck(name: str, values: Value, suits: Suit)¶

Bases: CardGroup

Class to represent a standard deck of cards.

A deck of cards with no jokers.

cards¶

A list of Card instances.

name¶

A name describing this deck.

add_deck(values: Value, suits: Suit)¶

Add deck of Cards.

Creates all the Card objects for one standard deck of cards and adds it to this deck. Can be used multiple times for larger deck sizes.

Parameters:

  • values – An Enumeration of the card values in the deck.

  • suits – An Enumeration of the card suits in the deck.

deal(number_of_cards: int, players: list[model.card_game.player.Player])¶

Deal Cards from this Deck.

Removes cards from the top of this Deck and adds them to the end CardGroup one by one until each CardGroup have the same number of Cards.

Parameters:

  • number_of_cards – An integer equal to the number of cards each

  • receive. (Player's hand should) –

  • players – A list of Players to receive the cards.

return_cards(card_group: CardGroup)¶

Returns Cards to Deck.

Adds all the Cards in the CardGroup face down. Then removes the Cards from the CardGroup.

Parameters:

card_group – A CardGroup object to return the cards from.

model.card_game.player module¶

class model.card_game.player.Player(id: int, name: str)¶

Bases: object

Class to represent a player in a card game.

id¶

An int to uniquely identify a player.

name¶

A string describing this player.

hand¶

A CardGroup for the Cards this player is holding.

model.card_game.suit module¶

class model.card_game.suit.Suit(value)¶

Bases: Enum

Enumeration class for the suit of a playing card.

Suit are the standard Clubs, Diamonds, Hearts and Spades.

name¶

A string for the name of the suit Clubs, Diamonds, Hearts and

Spades.
value¶

An integer for the value comparative value of each suit eg.

Spades are worth more than Hearts.
CLUBS = 1¶
DIAMONDS = 2¶
HEARTS = 3¶
SPADES = 4¶

model.card_game.value module¶

class model.card_game.value.Value(value)¶

Bases: Enum

Enumeration class for the value of a playing card.

Values for cards in a standard deck of cards where Aces are worth 1 and Kings are worth 13.

name¶

A string for the name of the card from Ace to King.

value¶

An integer unique to this Card in the Enumeration.

ACE = 1¶
EIGHT = 8¶
FIVE = 5¶
FOUR = 4¶
Jack = 11¶
King = 13¶
NINE = 9¶
Queen = 12¶
SEVEN = 7¶
SIX = 6¶
THREE = 3¶
TWO = 2¶
Ten = 10¶
game_value()¶

Returns the Value of the Card for the Game it is part of.

Edit this method to implement ace high or picture cards worth 10 for example.

Returns:

An integer equal to the Value of the Card in Game.

Module contents¶

Card Games
